markdownRemark.html:
The system works, I presume you have learnt that by now. But when does it stop doing that? What could possibly break it? This document clarifies any restrictions coming from our Twilio backend.

Creating your own Voiceflow diagram

We currently only support Voiceflow .vf diagrams upon upload and the limits of these include:

  • Built with only supported blocks.

    • Supported blocks include speak, block, interaction, start, and command.

  • Interaction blocks are limited to 2 choices.

    • There should be only two outgoing connections from one interaction block. The first being yes and the second being no. No more or less choices are currently supported as well as the top node must be Yes and the bottom must be No.

  • Maximum 597 speak nodes.

    • Voiceflow diagram should not exceed more than 597 nodes with type speak.

Deploying your own bots

When it comes to uploading and deploying your own chatbot, the limits include:

  • 50 Bots per Twilio account.

    • You can have 50 of these chatbots deployed at one time.

  • 64 number of characters for a bot name.

    • Due to Twilio, the maximum number of characters you can use to name your bot is limited to 64.

  • Name must fit specific format.

    • When naming your bot, only create a name with letters and numbers with spaces replaced by hyphens.

Users interacting with bots.

When users text your chatbot, there are a few limits which may effect how quickly a user gets a message or what you can send.

Messaging

  • Around two seconds response time.

    • Usually a single message is broken down into one or two message segments so you can expect a message to take around 1 or 2 seconds to reach a user.

  • Around 7200 messages can be sent at one time from a phone number.

    • Twilio puts messages onto a queue before being sent to a user and this queue is estimated to only hold around 7200 messages at one time.

  • Can handle ~500 messages per second from users per phone number.

    • Itâ€™s estimated that Twilio can handle 500 messages per second from users at a given time per phone number.

  • ~100 users can talk to a bot at a single time.

    • Due to limits with Twilio, only around 100 people per second can be interacting with a bot.

  • Currently support only UK long code phone numbers.

    • Limited to only processing long code numbers and no support for shortcode.

Technical Details (Developer View)

For developers wanting to know where the above mentioned limits come from.

Creating your own Voiceflow diagram

  • Maximum 597 speak nodes.

    • This is due to how each speak node is converted to a task and Twilio has a hard limit of 600 tasks per assistant but 3 are saved for predefined tasks.

      Deploying Bots

A bot is described as three components coming to one.

1. An assistant is created on Twilio Autopilot to invoke tasks based on user inputs and return a JSON action response.
2. A service is created on Twilio Functions to allow for routing between tasks.
3. A phone number linked to assistant to forward message responses.

  • 50 Bots per account.

    • This is due to the hard limit of 50 services per account.

  • 64 character name.

    • Maximum number of characters for a bot name as uniqueNames are limited to 64 characters.

  • Name must fit specific format.

    • The name must be alphanumeric with spaces being replaced by hyphens. The specific regex: ^(?=.$)[a-zA-Z0-9]+(?:-[a-zA-Z0-9]+)$].

Limits behind SMS on Twilio

Messages are first created on Twilio, put on the outbound queue and then finally the message is delivered via the carrier network.

Messaging

  • ~1 Message Segment per second per phone number.

    • This can vary for different countries and phone number types but the limit is 1 MPS. Twilio uses GSM character encoding with a 153 character message segment.

  • 14,400 Message Segment Outbound Queue Length.

    • Limited to 14400 message segment outbound queue per phone number.

  • ~500 messages per second Inbound Queue.

    • Can handle up to 500 incoming messages per second and make HTTP request to request URL. The request URL in our case would be the phone number webhook. Twilio doesnâ€™t specify if this is across all phone number or account-wide.

  • ~100 concurrent requests per account.

    • This means a maximum of 100 requests at once per account. If you max out Twilioâ€™s REST API concurrency limit, Twilio will begin responding to your requests with [HTTP 429] or [Error code 20429].

  • Currently support only UK long code phone numbers.

    • Limited to only processing long code numbers and no support for shortcode.

Deploying and Maintaining Bots.

Twilio Autopilot

Assistants

The Voiceflow diagram is broken down into tasks and with these tasks, an assistant is built. The limits of these assistants include:

  • 30-day retention for Queries.

    • Query endpoint takes your userâ€™s natural language input (text in this case) and returns structured JSON output with the results. Twilio will only hold this interaction between a user and bot for 30-days. Twilio doesnâ€™t specify the size of the queue.

  • ~10 Dialogues per second.

    • Able to generate a response to 10 questions per second before other dialogues are put onto queue. Twilio doesnâ€™t specify the size of this queue nor if this is account-wide or per assistant.

  • 16KB for the Assistant Memory.

    • Twilio will store the chain of Yes/No responses between a user and Twilio server and this memory has a limit of 16KB. Given that 5 responses between Twilio and a user has a memory size of ~1.35KB, you can have ~60 back and forth interactions. Exceeding this limit will throw the error: 90100 - Invalid Autopilot Actions JSON. This memory is per user.

  • 16KB for the Actions response.

    • When a Task is triggered, a task is ran by returning the action JSON. The largest action template used is 0.5KB so it is unlikely this is exceeded unless you create your own largest task template. This action response is limited to 16KB.

  • ~10-second request limit for fetching Actions JSON.

    • When a task is triggered, the actions JSON will be fetched within ~10 seconds.

Model

After all tasks, samples and fields are defined, you need to create a build for your specific model. The limits of this include:

  • A model must be completed within 60 minutes.

    • Increasing the number of fields, tasks, and samples will increase your build time. A 20 task bot takes ~10 seconds to build.

Simulator

Every time you are testing the bot within the electron application, you are interacting with Twilio Simulator.

  • Autopilot Dialogue Payload limited to 4KB.

    • Each character is two bytes, so you are limited to sending messages to a maximum of 2048 characters.

      Twilio Services

Functions & Assets

  • An account can have 50 services.

    • A service contains functions (collect.js handler script) and assets (mapping.json) and the limit to this is 50. This limits the number of fully defined bots you can have as each bot requires a service.

  • An account can do up to 100 builds per hour.

    • Builds are packages of Functions and Assets that you bundle together for deployment. Twilio doesnâ€™t specify what happens if this limit is breached.

  • Function execution time is limited to ~10 seconds.

    • Each time collect.js is invoked, it will only be given ~10 seconds to run. Currently collect.js takes ~1 second to respond but if extended it could take longer.

  • 10MB private asset

    • The generated mapping.json is a private asset and can be no larger than 10MB in size. A 15 node diagram produces an on average 1KB file, so you can have an estimated 150,000 nodes before this limit is reached.

node.excerpt: In parallel to our research findings, we were implementing functional proof of concept scripts. The actual scripts are not used in our endâ€¦
Our final product is a desktop application allowing users to convert VoiceFlow designs to SMS bots and deploy them behind real phone numbersâ€¦
Idea We wanted to define a stable file format for a bot which SMS systems can interface with. This format must only support bot capabilitiesâ€¦
Our product is a backend-less desktop app. While it is made to serve a specific purpose for the NHS, we have designed its architecture to beâ€¦
Idea We wanted to define a stable interface for the high-level actions we care about - creating, getting, and managing bot instances in anâ€¦

prev.excerpt: In the system architecture overview LINK, we summarised all key aspects of our system as designed for the purpose of NHS Medical Advice Botsâ€¦

next.excerpt: We understood the limits of the current solution, but that is assuming that what our system depends on keeps on working. Here we try toâ€¦
